links.title: Decoding James Webb Space Telescope – Daniel Estévez
links.description: The James Webb Space Telescope probably needs no introduction, since it is perhaps the most important and well-known mission of the last years. It was launched on Christmas day from Kourou, French Guiana, into a direct transfer orbit to the Sun-Earth L2 Lagrange point. JWST uses S-band at 2270.5 MHz to transmit telemetry. The science data will be transmitted in K-band at 29.5 GHz, with a rate of up to 28 Mbps.

links.title: Temporal fossa:Masseter muscle
links.description: The masseter is a quadrilateral shaped muscle of mastication, whose action is elevating and forward drawing of the angle of mandible. Anterior fibres run 45 degree backwards, while posterior fibre run vertically downwards. The upper anterior part of muscle is covered by an aponeurosis on which the parotid duct and accessory parotid gland lie. Origin: lower border of the zygomatic arch Insertion: whole of the lateral surface of the mandibular ramu...

links.title: Java Generics are Turing Complete
links.description:
This paper describes a reduction from the halting problem of Turing machines
to subtype checking in Java. It follows that subtype checking in Java is
undecidable, which answers a question posed by Kennedy and Pierce in 2007. It
also follows that Java's type checker can recognize any recursive language,
which improves a result of Gil and Levy from 2016. The latter point is
illustrated by a parser generator for fluent interfaces.

links.title: Fragility indices for only sufficiently likely modifications
links.description: In frequentist hypothesis testing, P values are used to establish statistical significance. Currently, there is an active movement to use alternative metrics, such as the fragility index, which measures how many outcome modifications in a clinical trial are required to reverse statistical significance. The fragility index approach compares to alternative outcomes that could have arisen from the same clinical trial. However, the existing fragility...
